dummy.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a model that is the shape and size of a person, especially used in order to show clothes in a shop or when you are making clothes
dummy.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: an object that is made to look like a tool, weapon, vehicle etc but which you cannot use
dummy.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: During practice runs, the warheads in the missiles will be dummies.
dummy.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a small model of a person, with a mouth that can be moved so that it looks as though it is talking, used for entertainment
dummy.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: a move in a sport such as football in which a player pretends to pass the ball but does not, in order to deceive the other team’s players
dummy.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: a specially shaped rubber object that you put in a baby’s mouth for it to suck
dummy.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: No, you dummy. The other hand.
dummy.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: cards that are placed on the table by one player for all the other players to see in a game of bridge
dummy.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a dummy tool, weapon, vehicle etc is made to look like a real one but you cannot use it
dummy.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: a product that is made to look like a real product and is used for testing, obtaining people’s opinions etc
dummy.translation[2].definitions[2].defi: a model of a human used for showing clothes in a shop window or for testing car safety
dummy.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: a dummy product is made to look like a real one and is used for tests, getting people’s opinions etc
dummy.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: 72% of the men in the group taking a dummy pill continued to lose hair.
dummy.translation[3].definitions[1].defi: a dummy organization is used to hide the real owner of assets, or to hide criminal activities
dummy.translation[3].definitions[1].exam: They had set up a series of dummy corporations to buy and sell 8,000 acres of useless New Mexico desert.
dummy.translation[3].definitions[2].defi: a dummy activity is used to make people think that something is happening when it is not
dummy.translation[3].definitions[2].exam: They used dummy trades to create a false impression of a more active market than really existed.
